place.name: LLOWES
place.gazetteerText: LLOWES, a parish in the district of Hay and county of Radnor; on the river Wye, at the boundary with Brecon, and on the Hereford and Brecon railway, 3 miles SW by W of Hay. Post town, Hay, under Hereford. Acres, 3,319. Real property, £3,127. Pop, 324. Houses, 69. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage, united with the vicarage of Llanddewi-Vach, in the diocese of St. David's. Valne, £132. Patron, the Archdeacon of Brecon. The church is very good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
